definition: net-like object/to hold sth in place with a net/to wind/to twist/(TCM) channels in the human body

sentences.english: A continuous stream of visitors came to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 参观展览会的人络绎不绝。

sentences.english: The night sky with colorful Band gorgeous, the crowd flocked to the carnival.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚，同乐坊的天空五彩斑斓，狂欢的人群络绎不绝。

sentences.english: After his speech, applause went on endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 讲话结束后，掌声络绎不绝。

sentences.english: Toward the Qin Shi, the number of people who proudly interest, flocked to forget.
sentences.chinese: 向着石琴，多少人兴致昂然，络绎不绝，流连忘返。

sentences.english: Family and friends streamed in and out to offer their sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 家人和朋友们络绎不绝地进进出出，表达他们的慰问。

sentences.english: The beautiful scenery of Lishan Mountain attracts a steady stream of visitors.
sentences.chinese: 骊山的美景吸引了络绎不绝的游人。

sentences.english: Qing River, pedestrian in a continuous line, the bloom of fireworks, bright star.
sentences.chinese: 清溪河畔，行人络绎不绝，两岸烟花烂漫，璀璨星河。

sentences.english: Brisk transactions provide Shouguang vegetables to cities near and far.
sentences.chinese: 络绎不绝的往来交易，将寿光的蔬菜传向四面八方。

sentences.english: During the endless stream of guests inside and outside the province, Mianzhu New Year trading extremely strong.
sentences.chinese: 期间，省内外客人络绎不绝，绵竹年画交易异常火爆。

sentences.english: Today is his wedding. Many people are streaming to his house.
sentences.chinese: 今天是婚礼，家门庭若市，来往宾客络绎不绝。

sentences.english: The gallery to people in a continuous line, whispers said only with opposite.
sentences.chinese: 长廊上晚来人络绎不绝，私语只说与对面人儿。

sentences.english: In the also pitch-dark road, villagers were coming to and fro silently.
sentences.chinese: 漆黑的街道上，络绎不绝的村民们在默默地你来我往。

sentences.english: Yesterday morning, there was an endless stream of tourists heading to Longqingxia to view the ice lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 昨日上午，前往龙庆峡观看冰灯的游客络绎不绝。

sentences.english: Neighbors and strangers flocked to him for advice and treatment.
sentences.chinese: 邻里或是陌生人都络绎不绝的来找他咨询和治疗。

definition: lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
to flock/to swarm/to congregate en masse/to cluster together
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
to thin out gradually/to become fainter and fainter
